sect1.title: Installation
sect1.para: This is a standard manual &sls; installation, for details about such a &slsa; installation, see the SLES &deploy;, Chapter 6, Installation with &yast;.
On the initial dialog, confirm the license (see ).

On the Registration dialog check your Network Configuration with the upper right button. The Network Settings will automatically pop up, if the automatic configuration via DHCP fails. Once the network configuration is checked, enter your registration data and confirm the dialog with Next.

note.title: Additional Packages Pre-Selected
note.para: If you install with registration, the &sle; &hasi; repository by default will be activated and some few &sle; &hasi; packages will get installed. This will not happen, if you will register the product after the installation.

sect1.para: You will be prompted for all common installation settings, like partitioning of storage devices, network, or software packages.

title.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard

sect1.para: This is a guided installation of the operating system with optimized settings for SAP applications.

During this installation scenario, the following installation and configuration steps will take place. Interactive settings are required or possible. At the end of the &sle; installation, you will be prompted to insert your SAP product media.

sect2.title: Data Required for Installing the System (with Wizard)
sect2.para: The following data is required for the &sls; part of the installation (required per physical server):

entry.para: Master password for the system installation (root password)

sect2.para: Some more specific parameters are required depending on the SAP application you want to install, for example SAP System ID or System T-Shirt Sizing.

sect2.title: Selecting SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard from the DVD Boot Menu
sect2.para: From the DVD boot menu (see ), select SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard. The installation process loads and configures a &sle; system with all requirements for an SAP installation. To view the boot messages and copyright notices during this process, press . On completion of this process, the &yast; installation program starts and displays the graphical installer, which will run mostly automatically.
On the initial dialog confirm the license (see ).

sect2.title: Preparing System for Automated Installation
sect2.para: After analyzing your computer, &yast; allows you to specify options for a customized installation.

sect3.title: Password for the System Administrator &rootuser;
sect3.para: First, &yast; prompts you to enter the system administrator password; see . This is the root password for the system.

&rootuser; is the name of the superuser, or the administrator of the system. Unlike regular users (who may or may not have permission to access certain areas or execute certain commands on the system), &rootuser; has unlimited access to change the system configuration, install programs, and set up new hardware. The &rootuser; account should only be used for system administration, maintenance, and repair. Logging in as &rootuser; for daily work is rather risky: a single mistake could lead to irretrievable loss of system files.
For verification purposes, the password for &rootuser; must be entered twice. Do not forget the &rootuser; password. Once entered, this password cannot be retrieved.
The &rootuser; password can be changed any time later in the installed system. To do so, run &yast; and start Security and Users User and Group Management .

warning.title: The root User
warning.para: The &rootuser; user has all the permissions needed to make changes to the system. To carry out such tasks, the &rootuser; password is required. You cannot carry out any administrative tasks without this password.

sect3.title: System Volume Configuration
sect3.para: The next &yast; pop-up dialog lets you fine-tune the volume configuration. Here you configure the volume for the system and swap space. Suitable values depending on your available hardware are pre-selected. This is for the &sle; operating system only. The data volume comes later, after selecting the SAP Application.
If there is just one hard disk, keep it as the system volume device and set the size of the system volume (and the swap space) in GB in the lower field and confirm it; see .

tip.title: Size of the System Volume
tip.para: Normally, at least 35 GB is required for the system volume. The swap space depends on the available main memory (RAM). For more information, see SAP Note 1984787 ()

sect3.para: If there is more than one hard disk, select the right one as the system volume device and set the size of the system volume (and the swap space) in GB in the lower fields and confirm it. For more information about partitioning, see .

warning.title: Deleting Data
warning.para: If you confirm the storage volume configuration, all existing data on the hard disk will be deleted. If you do not want this to happen, turn off the system.

sect3.title: Host Name, Domain Name, and IP Address
sect3.para: The next dialog starts with the network configuration; see .

figure.title: Host Name, Domain Name, and IP Address

tip.title: Querying DHCP Server
tip.para: The installation wizard will query a locally running DHCP server to get interesting network data such as names and IP adresses for the local host, DNS server, NTP server, etc. This ensures that the entry fields of the next dialogs will be prefilled with these data.

sect3.para: The Host name is the computer’s name in the network. The Domain Name is the name of the network. A host name and domain are proposed by default. If your system is part of a network, the host name has to be unique in this network, whereas the domain name has to be common to all hosts on the network.
Also enter the IP Address and Netmask for this host. The IP address must be unique and the netmask has to be common to all hosts on the network.

sect3.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) and Time Server (NTP)
sect3.para: The next dialog continues with the network configuration; see .

figure.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) and Time Server (NTP)

sect3.para: For Domain Name Service (DNS) configuration, enter the Domain Searchlist and the IP Address of DNS Server plus the IP address of the Default Gateway of your network.
Also enter the address of the NTP Server to synchronize automatically via Network Time Protocol (NTP).

sect3.title: Registration
sect3.para: To get technical support and product updates, you need to register and activate your product with the &scc;; see . This dialog provides assistance for doing so. For information about &scc;, see .

Enter your E-Mail Address and Registration Code for the product. If you provide the registration code now, operating system updates will be installed automatically during the installation of the system.

note.title: Additional Packages Pre-Selected
note.para: If you install with registration, the &sle; &hasi; repository by default will be activated and some few &sle; &hasi; packages will get installed. This will not happen, if you will register the product after the installation.

sect3.para: After confirmation, the system will be configured with the supplied settings. Then &yast; performs the partitioning and the software installation. Packages are installed one by one, so you can see the progress.
No user action is required at this stage.

warning.title: Firewall Disabled
warning.para: This wizard-based installation scenario disables the firewall (SuSEfirewall2) completely.

If needed, you can activate the firewall after the installation. If you activate the firewall after the installation, you must open all required ports manually. For more information about required ports, see .

title.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with External Profile

sect1.para: This installation is driven by a user-provided &ay; profile and there is no wizard support. This scenario is suitable for experienced users who are familiar with &ay; and want to deploy their own &ay; profiles to install &sles4sap;. For more information about &ay; profiles, see the SLES &ay; Guide (the &ay; Guide comes with the product or is available from ).

In order to use a user-provided &ay; profile, select Install SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with External Profile from the DVD Boot Menu. Within the boot options, change the autoyast=usb:/// parameter to the location of a user-provided &ay; profile, or enter the location when &yast; asks for it in the next dialog.

sect2.title: About &ay;
sect2.para: &ay; is a system for installing one or more &sle; systems automatically and without user intervention. &ay; installations are performed using an &ay; profile with installation and configuration data. That profile can be created using the &ay; configuration interface and can be provided to &yast; during installation in different ways.

sect2.title: Partitioning with &ay;
sect2.para: For standard systems find pre-defined partitioning settings in /usr/share/YaST2/include/sap-installation-wizard/. These could serve as examples if you want to create your custom partitioning scripts.
For background information on partitioning, see .
